title: European Option Pricing Under Generalized Tempered Stable Process: Empirical Analysis. (arXiv:2304.06060v1 [q-fin.PR])
abstract: The paper investigates the performance of the European option price when the log asset price follows a rich class of Generalized Tempered Stable (GTS) distribution. The GTS distribution is an alternative to Normal distribution and $\alpha$-Stable distribution for modeling asset return and many physical and economic systems. The data used to compute the option price comes from fitting the GTS distribution to the underlying daily SPY ETF return distribution. The Esscher transform method preserves the structure of the GTS process. Both the extended Black-Scholes formula and the Generalized Black-Scholes Formula are used in the study. The 12-point rule Composite Newton-Cotes Quadrature and the Fractional Fast Fourier (FRFT) algorithms were implemented and produce the same European option price at two decimal places. translated_abstract: 本文研究当对数资产价格遵循广义温和稳定（GTS）分布时的欧式期权价格表现。GTS分布是用于建模资产回报以及许多物理和经济系统的一种替代正态分布和$\alpha$-稳定分布的分布形式。用于计算期权价格的数据来自于将GTS分布拟合为基础每日SPY ETF回报分布。Esscher变换方法保留了GTS过程的结构。研究中使用了扩展的Black-Scholes公式和广义Black-Scholes公式。实施了12点规则复合Newton-Cotes求积法和分数快速傅里叶（FRFT）算法，并在两个小数位产生相同的欧式期权价格。与GTS分布下的期权价格相比，Black-Scholes（BS）模型在Near-The-Money（NTM）和in-the-money（ITM）期权方面被定价过低。然而，最大误差在16个基点以下。
tldr: 本文研究了使用广义温和稳定分布模型欧式期权定价的过程，并发现相较于黑-斯科尔斯模型，该模型在实证分析中定价更为准确。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the use of a Generalized Tempered Stable (GTS) distribution for pricing European options and finds that, compared to the Black-Scholes model, the GTS model provides more accurate pricing in empirical analysis.
